Package camzup.core

Class Color

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Color
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Color>
Direct Known Subclasses:
KtClr
public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Color>
A mutable, extensible color class. Supports RGBA, HSLA and HSVA color spaces. Converts to and from integers where color channels are in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Color.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of color easing functions.
    static class  Color.ChannelOrder
    Order in which to arrange color channels when flattening color to an array.
    static class  Color.HueCCW
    Eases between hues in the clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueCW
    Eases the hue in the counter-clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueEasing
    An abstract parent class for hue easing functions.
    static class  Color.HueFar
    Eases between hues by the farthest rotational direction.
    static class  Color.HueNear
    Eases between hues by the nearest rotational direction.
    static class  Color.LerpRgba
    Eases between two colors.
    static class  Color.MixHsla
    Eases between colors by hue, saturation and lightness.
    static class  Color.MixHsva
    Eases between colors by hue, saturation and value.
    static class  Color.SmoothStepRgba
    Eases between two colors with the smooth step formula: t2 ( 3.0 - 2.0 t ) .

    static float luminance​(int c)
    Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .

    Colors stored as integers are less precise than those stored as floats (1.0 / 255.0 being the smallest difference between a channel of two integer colors).
    static float luminance​(Color c)
    Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .

      public int compareTo​(Color c)

    • bitRotateLeft

      public static Color bitRotateLeft​(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, rotates to the left by the number of places, then converts the result to a color. The rotate a whole color channel, use increments of 8 (8, 16, 24).
      Parameters:
      a - the color
      places - the number of places
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the rotated color
      See Also:
      fromHex(int, Color), toHexInt(Color)

      public static Color bitShiftLeft​(Color a, int places, Color target)

    • fromHex

      public static Color fromHex​(java.lang.String c, Color target)
      Attempts to convert a hexadecimal String to a color. Recognized formats include:
      • "abc" - RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "#abc" - hash tag, RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "aabbcc" - RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "#aabbcc" - hash tag, RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "aabbccdd" - AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "0xaabbccdd" - '0x' prefix, AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      The output color will be reset if no suitable format is recognized.
      Parameters:
      c - the input String
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      Integer.parseInt(String, int), Long.parseLong(String, int), fromHex(int, Color), String.replaceAll(String, String), String.substring(int)

    • fromHex

      public static Color[] fromHex​(java.lang.String[] cs)
      Converts an array of Strings that represent colors in hexadecimal into an array of colors
      Parameters:
      cs - the colors
      Returns:
      the array

    • fromKeyword

      public static Color fromKeyword​(java.lang.String keyword, Color target)
      Returns one of the 16 web safe colors from a string key word. See HTML color names.

      Differences in naming conventions include:
      • (0.0, 1.0, 1.0) may be either aqua or cyan;
      • (1.0, 0.0, 1.0) may be either fuchsia or magenta;
      • (0.0, 1.0, 0.0) is lime, not green;
      • (0.0, 0.5, 0.0) is green.
      Parameters:
      keyword - the key word
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color by keyword

    • inverse

      public static Color inverse​(Color c, Color target)
      Inverts a color by subtracting the red, green and blue channels from one. Similar to bitNot, except alpha is unaffected. Also similar to adding 0.5 to the x component of a Vec4 storing hue, saturation and value.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the inverse
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp01(float)

    • luminance

      public static float luminance​(Color c)
      Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the luminance

    • luminance

      public static float luminance​(int c)
      Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .

      Colors stored as integers are less precise than those stored as floats (1.0 / 255.0 being the smallest difference between a channel of two integer colors). Combined with single precision when multiplying small numbers (all weighting factors must be divided by 255.0 ), this will not yield the same result as luminance(Color) .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the luminance

    • magenta

      public static Color magenta​(Color target)
      Returns the color magenta, ( 1.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0 ) .
      Parameters:
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      magenta

      public static boolean none​(Color c)

      c - the color
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • pingPong

      public static Color pingPong​(Color origin, Color dest, float step, float pause, Color target)
      Oscillates between an origin and destination color based on an input step and a pause factor. When the pause is greater than 1.0, the value will be clamped to the pole.
      Parameters:
      origin - the original color
      dest - the destination color
      step - the step
      pause - the pause factor
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the oscillation

    • pow

      public static Color pow​(Color a, float b, Color target)
      Raises a color's red, green and blue channels to the power of a scalar. The alpha channel is unaffected. Useful when adjusting the color's gamma.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the result

      Returns:
      the multiplied color

    • quantize

      public static Color quantize​(Color c, int levels, Color target)
      Reduces the signal, or granularity, of a color's channels. Any level less than 2 or greater than 255 returns sets the target to the input.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      levels - the levels
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the posterized color
      See Also:
      Vec4.quantize(Vec4, int, Vec4), Utils.floor(float)
